page.title: 18DUNSTER SCHOOL 1
page.content: In 1842 a Methodist preacher, Mr. William Moore, died bequeathing Â£800 to endow a Wesleyan day school in Dunster. This school, built in 1825 in Mill Lane was the first day school in the Exeter District. The school was rebuilt in 1853 and provided education for 40 children. By the mid 19th century there were two dame schools in the village. It was not until 1861 that a school professing to teach reading, writing and religious instruction to boys and girls of the parish was found to exist in Dunster. The school was supported chiefly by H.F. Luttrell, the Lord of the Manor.
